ACT
42
CONTENTS OF THE WILL
In the event of death, the testator is authorized to dispose of everything that he was authorized to dispose of during his lifetime, unless otherwise specifically prescribed.
The testator can produce the same legal effects with his will that he could have during his lifetime by unilaterally expressing his will, unless otherwise prescribed.
With his will, the testator can only cause inheritance effects that are provided for in this Act.
The extent to which the testator is limited in his freedom of disposal in favor of his family members is determined by the provisions of this Act on compulsory inheritance.
